summary: This document details the execution of a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's residence on July 11, 2019. During the search, agents recovered two suitcases containing various items, including multiple passports, cash, jewelry, and electronic devices. The document outlines the inventory process and the individuals involved in the search and recovery of the items.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Richard Kahn is mentioned as the house manager who packed Jeffrey Epstein's belongings and transported them to his residence.

persons.name: Merwin Delacruz
persons.context: Merwin Delacruz is referenced as the individual who packed Epstein's belongings from his safe.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the search warrant, with numerous personal items being inventoried from his suitcases.

persons.name: Kelly Maguire
persons.context: Kelly Maguire is the FBI agent who made contact with Richard Kahn and oversaw the inventory of the items recovered from the suitcases.

persons.name: Brian S. Mitchell
persons.context: Brian S. Mitchell is mentioned as the agent who drafted the document detailing the search and inventory process.

connections.description: Richard Kahn worked as the house manager for Jeffrey Epstein, responsible for managing his belongings.
Merwin Delacruz was involved in packing Jeffrey Epstein's belongings from his safe.
Both are FBI agents involved in the investigation and documentation of the search warrant execution.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant
events.description: A search warrant was executed at Jeffrey Epstein's residence, leading to the recovery of various personal items.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
26 Federal Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: A search warrant was executed at Jeffrey Epstein's residence on July 11, 2019.
Two suitcases were recovered from Richard Kahn, containing multiple passports, cash, jewelry, and electronic devices.
The items included an expired U.S. passport and four additional U.S. passports belonging to Jeffrey Epstein.
The inventory process was documented by FBI agents, including Kelly Maguire and Brian S. Mitchell.
The suitcases were secured within a safe at the FBI's New York Operation Center after the inventory.
